sentences.en: A teacher must not discriminate between pupils.
sentences.cn: 老师对学生应当一视同仁.

sentences.en: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
sentences.cn: 他没能力在一个好主意和一个坏主意之间进行区分。

sentences.en: How can he discriminate the real painting from the false one?
sentences.cn: 他怎么能把真画和假画分辨出来 呢 ?

sentences.en: If you want to grasp English, you must carefully discriminate synonyms.
sentences.cn: 如果你想掌握好英语, 你必须仔细区分同义词.

sentences.en: It is against federal law to discriminate against blacks.
sentences.cn: 歧视黑人是违反联邦法律的.

sentences.en: It is unjust and unlawful to discriminate against people of other races.
sentences.cn: 歧视外族人是不公正的,也是违法的.

sentences.en: No law in China contains clauses that discriminate against women.
sentences.cn: 任何一部中国法律都不存在对妇女的歧视性条款.

sentences.en: The boy is too young to discriminate good books from bad ones.
sentences.cn: 这孩子太小,分不清好书和坏书.

sentences.en: The Commission for Racial Equality teaches organisations not to discriminate.
sentences.cn: 种族平等委员会告诫各家机构不要心存歧视。

sentences.en: The computer program was unable to discriminate between letters and numbers.
sentences.cn: 这计算机程序不能辨别字母与数字。

sentences.en: The device can discriminate between the cancerous and the normal cells.
sentences.cn: 这台仪器可以辨别癌细胞和正常的细胞。

sentences.en: The impressions are wrong, people now no longer discriminate each other, the crimination only exists in few people.
sentences.cn: 这些印象都是错误的，人们现在不再彼此歧视，歧视只在少数人身上存在。

sentences.en: The law does not discriminate against the poor in favour of the rich.
sentences.cn: 法律绝不歧视穷人而偏袒富人.

sentences.en: The two brothers are so much alike ; it is difficult to discriminate one from the other.
sentences.cn: 这两兄弟太相像了, 很难识别他们.

sentences.en: They can discriminate hundreds of colours.
sentences.cn: 他们能分辨上百种颜色.

sentences.en: This boy can discriminate minute variations in tone.
sentences.cn: 这位男孩能辨别出音调的细微变化.

sentences.en: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
sentences.cn: 联邦法律规定，歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

sentences.en: You must learn to discriminate between facts and opinions.
sentences.cn: 你必须学会把事实和看法区分出来.

words.tran_cn: 识别的；有差别的；有识别力的
区别的，歧视的；有识别力的
有辨识力的；差别对待的

trans.tran_en: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way

trans.tran_cn: 区别， 辨别； 有差别地对待， 歧视
trans.tran_en: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way
